qas.question: Why did parties that relied on donations or subscriptions run into problems?

answers.text: increased scrutiny of donations there has been a long-term decline in party memberships

qas.question: When did parties that relied on donations start to run into problems?

plausible_answers.text: less than an 1/8 of what it was

qas.question: What was the population of Australia in the 20th century compared to 1950?

context: From the <a1_0>second half of the 20th century<a1_0/> on parties which continued to rely on donations or membership subscriptions ran into <b4_0>mounting problems<b4_0/>. Along with the <a0_0>increased scrutiny of donations there has been a long-term decline in party memberships<a0_0/> in most western democracies which itself places more strains on funding. For example, in the United Kingdom and Australia membership of the two main parties in <b3_0>2006<b3_0/> is <b2_0>less than an 1/8 of what it was<b2_0/> in <b6_0>1950<b6_0/>, despite <b5_0>significant increases<b5_0/> in population over that period.
